faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: We solve your most common doubts. If you can't find the answer, write to us.

1.question: Do you accept all types of pieces?
1.answer: We accept and work solely with original LEGO® pieces and minifigures. If you send us other types of toys or pieces from other brands, we will separate them and return them to you with your order.

2.question: Can you clean any type of dirt?
2.answer: We clean and sanitize industrially using hospital technology, but we don't work miracles. We reserve the right to return damaged pieces, non-sanitizable items (markers, corrosion, acid stains), or pieces with plastic burnt by the sun or friction.

3.question: Do you guarantee there will be no sorting errors?
3.answer: We work with original second-hand pieces, official suppliers, and LEGO.com. We can make sorting errors or miss pieces... we are human. If this happens, let us know and we will replace any possible errors.

4.question: Do you get the original minifigures for the sets?
4.answer: We can suggest minifigures from the same series as the set, but not necessarily the specific ones that came with the original set if they are very expensive or hard-to-find collector's items. We will always propose an original and possible substitute.

5.question: Do I have to send the sets disassembled?
5.answer: We accept messy sets, mixed pieces, and semi-assembled sets. We advise you to disassemble them as they will take up less space and shipping will be more efficient. But if you send them together, we also like disassembling LEGO® and will do it for you. If some pieces cannot be separated (glue?, torsion?, semi-worn plastic?), we will leave them aside and return them.

6.question: What can I expect to get from my LEGO® boxes?
6.answer: There are multiple factors that affect the number, variety, and cost of the sets we can recover. An 80% complete set is cheaper to rebuild than a 50% one. Also, if it is from 'bestseller' series like Star Wars™, LEGO® City, or LEGO® Technic, there is more volume and better spare part pricing than in niche series.

7.question: Do you recover old sets?
7.answer: We recover sets from after 1960. However, keep in mind that the cost of pieces for these old sets may be higher due to their scarcity.

8.question: What kind of designs do you propose with my pieces?
8.answer: It depends on the variety and theme of your pieces. With several semi-complete sets of the same theme, we can suggest sets and new creations from the same series, and we will have more options than with a drawer of 2x2 and 3x3 bricks in blue, white, and red. The fewer set series you mix the better, and the more variety of pieces the better.

9.question: Is your process safe for children with allergies?
9.answer: Yes. By not using industrial softeners or perfumes, and basing our cleaning on physical (ultrasound) and enzymatic processes, we minimize any risk of contact dermatitis.

10.question: Does the process damage LEGO® pieces?
10.answer: On the contrary. Ultrasonic washing is much gentler than a domestic dishwasher. Since there is no aggressive mechanical friction, the original shine of the plastic is maintained for longer and the connections remain perfect.

1.title: 1. About the Service
1.content: Brickclinic offers sorting, cleaning, set assembly, creative building proposals, and organized return services for brick construction pieces. Our services are performed manually with professional care, but involve the handling of small and delicate plastic parts.

2.title: 2. Intellectual Property Disclaimer
content: IMPORTANT NOTICE: Brickclinic is an independent initiative.
We are not affiliated, endorsed, sponsored, or connected in any way with the LEGO Group or any of its subsidiaries or affiliates.

LEGO®, the LEGO® logo, the Minifigure, DUPLO®, and all other trademarks and trade dress of LEGO® are the property of the LEGO Group. All references to LEGO® products on this website are made solely for identification and descriptive purposes to indicate the compatibility of our services.
Brickclinic does not manufacture, sell, or distribute new LEGO® products. We provide independent aftermarket services exclusively for pieces already owned by our customers.

3.title: 3. Limitation of Liability — Handling Risks
3.content: By using our services, the client acknowledges and accepts the following:
list: Wear and Age: Construction bricks, especially old or heavily used pieces, may show signs of wear, discoloration, or micro-scratches. These are inherent to the age and prior use of the pieces and are not caused by our handling process.

Risk of Breakage: Brickclinic assumes no responsibility for broken pieces that, due to their age, prior condition, fragility, or material stress (such as brittle brown plastic syndrome), may be damaged during normal professional handling. Although we exercise the utmost care, there is an inherent risk when handling aged pieces.

Degradation of Stickers and Prints: Printed pieces and pieces with stickers may suffer degradation during the cleaning process due to their age or the condition of the adhesive. We treat them with special care (hand cleaning), but we cannot guarantee their total preservation if they are already deteriorated.
Missing Pieces: We are not responsible for pieces that were already missing from the client's collection prior to receipt. Our inventory is strictly based on what we physically receive.
Liability Limit: In any event, Brickclinic's total liability for any claim arising from our services shall not exceed the price of the service paid by the client for the specific order in question.

4.title: 4. Shipping and Transit
4.content: Brickclinic is not responsible for loss or damage occurring during transit to our facilities. We strongly recommend using insured and tracked shipping services. Once the pieces are delivered to our facilities, they are under our care and covered by the limitations described in Section 3.

5.title: 5. Client Obligations
list: The client must send only original and compatible construction bricks.
Non-original pieces, batteries, damaged electronic components, foreign objects, or excessive/hazardous dirt must not be included.
The client is responsible for accurately describing the contents of their shipment.

6.title: 6. Pricing and Payment
6.content: Prices are determined based on weight, volume, and specific services requested. A final quote will be provided upon receipt and inspection, which must be approved by the client before work begins. If the client rejects the final quote, the pieces will be returned at the client's expense.

7.title: 7. Unclaimed Orders
7.content: If an order is not picked up, paid for, or if the client does not respond to notifications for more than 90 days after the completion notice, Brickclinic reserves the right to dispose of the pieces at its discretion to cover storage and management costs.

8.title: 8. Governing Law
8.content: These terms are governed by the laws of Spain. Any dispute related to these terms or our services shall be submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Barcelona, Spain.

9.title: 9. Contact
9.content: For any questions regarding these terms, please contact us at info@brickclinic.es.
